lead_paragraph: A report suggests that one in five smartphone users worldwide deploys software to remove ads when he or she browses the web.

headline.print_headline: Rise of Ad-Blocking Software Could Cost Web Companies Billions in Lost Revenue
headline.main: Rise of Ad-Blocking Software Threatens Online Revenue

snippet: A report suggests that one in five smartphone users worldwide deploys software to remove ads when he or she browses the web.
abstract: One in five smartphone users, amounting to almost 420 million people worldwide, use ad-blocking software when browsing web on their phones; shift threatens Internet companies like Google and Facebook that rely heavily on advertising.
